intro: Plectocomia microstachys, commonly known as the Mexican firecracker plant, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking red, tubular flowers that resemble firecrackers. The plant typically grows as a shrub with upright stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it suitable for xeriscaping in arid climates. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its vibrant blooms that appear in summer.
